documentation: With Shopify modules in Boltic, you can manage your Shopify store's products, orders, and more. If you don't have an Shopify account, you can create one at . ## Authentication Ways - Access Token # How to Get an Access Token for a Shopify Account ## Step 1: Create a Shopify Account & Store 1. Go to Shopify Support Documentation . 2. Click **Start free trial** and create an account. 3. Set up your **store name** (e.g., `mystore.myshopify.com`). 4. Complete store setup and go to your **Shopify Admin Dashboard**. --- ## Step 2: Enable Custom App Development Before creating an app, you need to enable **custom app development** in your store. 1. In **Shopify Admin**, go to **Settings** > **Apps and sales channels**. 2. Click **Develop apps**. 3. If prompted, click **Allow custom app development**. 4. Click **Create an app**. --- ## Step 3: Create a New App 1. Enter a **name** for your app (e.g., "My API App"). 2. Select the **App Developer** (your Shopify account). 3. Click **Create App**. --- ## Step 4: Configure API Access To allow your app to access Shopify data: 1. Go to the **API Credentials** tab. 2. Click **Configure Admin API Scopes**. 3. Select the required **scopes** based on what your app needs: - `read_products`, `write_products` (for product management) - `read_orders`, `write_orders` (for order access) - `read_customers`, `write_customers` (for customer data) 4. Click **Save**. 5. Webhooks for required resource requires write scope. --- ## Step 5: Install the App & Get Access Token 1. Go to the **API Credentials** tab. 2. Click **Install App** (this generates an **Admin API Access Token**). 3. Copy the **Admin API Access Token** (it is shown **only once**). 4. Store it securelyâ€”this token is used for API calls. --- ## Step 6: Find Your Shopify Domain To make API requests, you need your **Shopify store domain**. 1. Go to your **Shopify Admin Dashboard**. 2. Look at the browser URL:https://your-store-name.myshopify.com/admin Your Shopify domain is your-store-name
